Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that House Democrats are voting to bar the playing of the U.S. national anthem prior to sporting events, when in fact there is no truth to this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources provided to back up the assertion that House Democrats are taking such action.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that House Democrats find the national anthem offensive to people from other countries, without providing any evidence or basis for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that House Democrats have neither held nor attempted to hold a vote on barring the playing of the national anthem.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim falsely attributes the motivation for this supposed action to U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar and Colin Kaepernick, without any evidence to support this alternative explanation.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting false information and relying on unreliable sources, such as the All News website, which has been categorized as purveyors of junk news and inflammatory misinformation.
